page.title: 14FARMING EAST OF THE SEVERN
page.content: The land here is undulating,rising to around 100 metres,with a large amount under forest cover at Dudmaston forest Although modern agriculture is now mainly mechanised,hand tillage is still used at one farm in Mose,where hoes are used on land near farm buildings.Farming is mainly arable especilly sugar beet and barley.The fields are between 12_20acres (smaller than west), with hawthorn hedges and linked by rough tracks. The gates at each field entrance are iron rather than wood.{ { LODGE FARM}covers 260 acres with crops of onions, cereal, sugar beet, with a main crop of potatoes that are sold to Everest Frozen Foods. There are two types of soil; sandy, which requires fertilizer and silt soil from the river. 8.8 million gallons of water are used for irrigation.
